ground_truth: She leads Kate by the hand to a picnic laid out on the lounge floor. Sitting on cushions in front of a roaring fire, under a sheet stretched out like a safari tent, the trio share the pizza. Zoe pretends to be an elephant, and the three then play pick-up sticks with bread sticks. By the light of several candles, Zoe acts out a charade as wax drips down tall candlesticks beside a half-empty cafetiere of coffee. Zoe fast asleep on a cushion, Nick crawls round to her and lifts her from the floor. His shadow casts on the side of the sheet tent as he carries her out, while Kate takes out a small tray with two espresso cups on it. She pauses to look down the hallway and watch Nick gently carry Zoe to her bedroom before turning back and staring ahead thoughtfully. Later, the pair are tidying up when Nick opens the fridge and takes out the Tupperware box Kate found in his bag. They sit on the lounge floor with a tiramisu between them; Kate's face brightens as she tastes a spoonful. The candles and firelight illuminate the room as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and licks the cream from his finger, gazing intently at her. Kate's face is turned towards Nick, but she looks away briefly and nods. He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer, lips almost touching, she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his scarf and stands, picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa, and puts it on as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants. Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist, he spins around in his leather chair, and Kate furrows her brow. Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office, then leaves. In the park, Zoe is walking on the benches, then runs off, leading Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids being hit by a Yellow Cab as she runs across a busy road, and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her, but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off. Later, Zoe is on her bed looking at the photo album, and as she flicks through it, she finds a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash and sighs, her eyes welling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where, in the dark and deserted kitchen, she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter, talking happily together. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick dashes out of his truck outside Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She guides Kate by the hand to a picnic arranged on the lounge floor. Resting on cushions in front of a blazing fire, beneath a sheet expanded like a safari tent, the trio divide the pizza. Zoe feigns to be an elephant, and the three then play pick-up sticks with breadsticks. By the glow of several candles, Zoe enacts a charade as wax drips down tall candlesticks beside a half-empty cafetiere of coffee. Zoe fast asleep on a cushion, Nick creeps around to her and lifts her from the floor. His shadow projects on the side of the sheet tent as he bears her out, while Kate removes a small tray with two espresso cups on it. She pauses to glance down the hallway and observe Nick gently carry Zoe to her bedroom before turning back and staring ahead thoughtfully. Later, the pair are tidying up when Nick opens the refrigerator and takes out the Tupperware container Kate found in his bag. They sit on the lounge floor with a tiramisu between them; Kate's face brightens as she tastes a spoonful. The candles and firelight illuminate the room as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and licks the cream from his finger, gazing intently at her. Kate's face is turned towards Nick, but she looks away briefly and nods. He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer, lips almost touching, she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his scarf and stands, picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa, and puts it on as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his trousers. Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist, he spins around in his leather chair, and Kate furrows her brow. Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office, then departs. In the park, Zoe is strolling on the benches, then runs off, leading Kate to pursue after her. Zoe narrowly avoids being struck by a Yellow Cab as she runs across a busy road, and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her, but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off. Later, Zoe is on her bed looking at the photo album, and as she flips through it, she finds a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash and sighs, her eyes welling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where, in the dark and deserted kitchen, she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter, conversing happily together. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick dashes out of his truck outside Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description:
Transformed text:

Kate is led by her to a picnic laid out on the lounge floor by the hand. Sitting on cushions in front of a roaring fire, under a sheet stretched out like a safari tent, the pizza is shared by the trio. An elephant is pretended to be by Zoe, and pick-up sticks are played with bread sticks by the three. Several candles light Zoe, who acts out a charade as wax drips down tall candlesticks beside a half-empty cafetiere of coffee. As Zoe is fast asleep on a cushion, she is crawled round to by Nick, who lifts her from the floor. His shadow is cast on the side of the sheet tent as he carries her out, while a small tray with two espresso cups on it is taken out by Kate. She pauses to look down the hallway and watches Nick gently carry Zoe to her bedroom before she turns back and stares ahead thoughtfully. Later, the pair tidy up when the fridge is opened by Nick, who takes out the Tupperware box that was found by Kate in his bag. They sit on the lounge floor with a tiramisu between them; Kate's face is brightened as a spoonful is tasted by her. The room is illuminated by the candles and firelight as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and he licks the cream from his finger, gazing intently at her. Nick turns Kate's face towards him, but she looks away briefly and nods. Kate is reached behind by him and moved nearer, lips almost touching, she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts awkwardly as his scarf is put on by Nick, who stands and picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa, and it is put on by him as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants. A serene smile is given by Kate to herself. At the therapist, he spins around in his leather chair, and the brow of Kate is furrowed. The headmistress is joined by Kate in her spacious office, then she leaves. In the park, Zoe is seen walking on the benches, then she runs off, which leads Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids a hit by a Yellow Cab as she runs across a busy road, and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her, but ultimately she steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off. Later, Zoe is seen on her bed looking at the photo album, and as she flicks through it, a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash is found by her, and she sighs, her eyes welling with tears. Sean's apartment is descended by Kate where, in the dark and deserted kitchen, a plate of food is shared by her and Nick, and red wine is drunk across the serving counter, talking happily together. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick dashes out of his truck outside Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She guides Kate to a picnic on the lounge floor. Seated on cushions before a fire, under a makeshift safari tent, they share pizza. Zoe pretends to be an elephant, and they play pick-up sticks with bread sticks. By candlelight, Zoe acts in a charade, wax dripping beside a half-empty coffee cafetiere. Zoe asleep on a cushion, Nick gently lifts her. His shadow casts on the tent as Kate fetches a tray with espresso cups. She watches Nick carry Zoe to bed, then returns thoughtfully. Later, tidying up, Nick retrieves the Tupperware from Kateâ€™s bag. They enjoy tiramisu; Kate's face lights up. Candles and firelight illuminate them as Nick wipes cream from her mouth and licks it, gazing at her. She looks away and nods as he moves closer, but she leans awkwardly as Nick dons his scarf and jacket, heading to the dark kitchen for his pants. Kate smiles to herself. At the therapist, he spins in his chair, while Kate frowns. She meets the headmistress, then leaves. In the park, Zoe runs off, leading Kate to chase her. Zoe narrowly escapes a Yellow Cab, and Kate hesitantly watches her go. Later, Zoe is on her bed with a photo album, finding a peacock feather like one she had before the crash, her eyes welling. Kate visits Sean's apartment, sharing food and red wine with Nick in the dim kitchen, talking happily. Finally, in pouring rain, Nick rushes from his truck outside Kate's apartment.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She leads Kate to a picnic on the lounge floor. Sitting on cushions by a fire under a makeshift tent, they share pizza. Zoe pretends to be an elephant, and they play pick-up sticks with bread sticks. By candlelight, Zoe acts out a charade, wax dripping beside a half-empty cafetiere. Zoe asleep on a cushion, Nick lifts her, his shadow on the sheet, while Kate pauses with two espresso cups, watching Nick carry Zoe to bed. Later, tidying, Nick retrieves a Tupperware from the fridge and sits on the floor with Kate, enjoying tiramisu. Nick wipes cream from Kate's mouth, then moves closer, lips almost touching. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick dons his scarf and jacket, entering the kitchen to retrieve his pants. Kate smiles to herself. At the therapist, he spins in his chair, and Kate frowns. Kate visits the headmistress, then leaves. In the park, Zoe runs on benches and narrowly avoids a Yellow Cab, as Kate steps back, watching helplessly. Later, Zoe finds a peacock feather in a photo album and tears up. Kate goes to Sean's, where she and Nick share food and wine, talking happily. Finally, Nick runs out of his truck in the rain outside Kate's apartment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Taking Kate gently by the hand, she leads her to a delightful picnic thoughtfully arranged on the lounge floor. They sit comfortably on soft cushions positioned in front of a roaring, warm fire. Underneath a sheet that is cleverly stretched out to resemble an adventurous safari tent, the trio enjoys sharing slices of delicious pizza. Zoe, with playful imagination, pretends to be a grand elephant, and following this, the three engage in a light-hearted game of pick-up sticks, amusingly using crunchy breadsticks for the game. In the warm, gentle glow of several flickering candles, Zoe becomes animated, acting out an engaging charade while wax slowly drips down the sides of tall, elegant candlesticks standing next to a half-empty cafetiere of rich, aromatic coffee. Once Zoe falls soundly asleep on a cushion, Nick carefully crawls over to her and gently lifts her from the floor. His shadow dances across the side of the sheet tent as he carries her out of the room, while Kate thoughtfully removes a small tray bearing two espresso cups. She pauses for a moment to look down the hallway, observing Nick as he tenderly carries Zoe to her bedroom, before turning back and gazing ahead with a contemplative expression. Later on, as the pair busy themselves tidying up, Nick opens the fridge and retrieves the Tupperware box that Kate had earlier discovered in his bag. Together, they sit on the lounge floor, placing a tempting tiramisu between them. Kate's face lights up with delight as she tastes a spoonful of the delectable dessert. The warm light from the candles and the flickering fire illuminates the room as Nick moves closer to sit beside Kate. He tenderly reaches out to wipe a small spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, then licks the cream from his finger, all the while gazing intently into her eyes. Kate, with her face turned towards Nick, briefly looks away and nods. He reaches behind Kate, moving even closer to her, their lips almost touching, as she leans back against his supportive arm. Kate shifts slightly, feeling awkward, as Nick picks up his scarf, stands, and retrieves his jacket from where it draped over the back of the sofa. He puts it on and enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants, while Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist's office, he spins around in his comfortable leather chair, while Kate furrows her brow with deep thought. Afterwards, Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office for a brief meeting, then departs. In the park, Zoe energetically walks along the benches, then suddenly takes off running, prompting Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids a near collision with a speeding Yellow Cab as she dashes across a bustling road, with Kate dodging traffic in hot pursuit. However, she ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off into the distance. Much later, Zoe is found on her bed, intently looking through a photo album. As she flips through the pages, she discovers a peacock feather, reminiscent of the one she was playing with shortly before the car accident. She sighs deeply, eyes welling with tears. Meanwhile, Kate makes her way down to Sean's apartment where, in the quiet and deserted kitchen, she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter, happily chatting together. Finally, in the midst of a heavy downpour, Nick hurriedly dashes out of his truck parked outside Kate's apartment building, determined and focused.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Taking Kate gently by the hand, she leads her to a delightful picnic thoughtfully arranged right on the lounge floor. The setup is warm and inviting, as they sit comfortably nestled on soft cushions, strategically positioned in front of a roaring and warm fire that casts a cozy glow around them. Above, a sheet is cleverly stretched to resemble the peeked roof of an adventurous safari tent, creating an imaginative backdrop under which the trio enjoys sharing generous slices of delicious, cheesy pizza. Zoe, brimming with playful imagination, pretends to be a grand and majestic elephant. Following this whimsical display, the three engage in a light-hearted game of pick-up sticks, amusingly using crunchy breadsticks as their makeshift game pieces. Bathed in the warm, gentle glow of several flickering candles, Zoe becomes animated, acting out an engaging charade. Meanwhile, wax slowly drips down the sides of tall, elegant candlesticks standing next to a half-empty cafetiere filled with rich, aromatic coffee. Once Zoe eventually falls soundly asleep on one of the plush cushions, Nick carefully and quietly crawls over to her, gently lifting her from the floor. His shadow dances across the side of the makeshift sheet tent as he carries her out of the room, while Kate thoughtfully removes a small tray bearing two espresso cups. She pauses for a contemplative moment, looking down the hallway to observe Nick as he tenderly carries Zoe to her bedroom. Turning back, she gazes ahead with a thoughtful expression. Later on, as the pair busies themselves tidying up the room, Nick opens the fridge and retrieves a Tupperware box that Kate had discovered earlier in his bag. Together, they sit comfortably on the lounge floor, placing a tempting, delectable tiramisu between them. Kate's face lights up with sheer delight as she tastes a spoonful of the scrumptious dessert. The warm light from the candles and the flickering fire illuminate the room as Nick moves closer to her side, tenderly reaching out to wipe a small spot of cream from the right side of her mouth. He then licks the cream from his finger, all the while gazing intently into her eyes, holding her gaze. Kate, her face turned towards him, briefly looks away before nodding slightly. He reaches behind her, moving even closer so that their lips are almost touching, as she leans back against his supportive arm. However, feeling a sudden awkwardness, Kate shifts slightly. Nick then picks up his scarf, stands, and retrieves his jacket from where it is draped over the back of the sofa. After putting it on, he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants, while Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist's office, he spins around restlessly in his comfortable leather chair, while Kate furrows her brow, lost in deep thought. Afterwards, she joins the headmistress in her spacious office for a brief, necessary meeting, before departing. In the park, Zoe energetically walks along the benches, then suddenly takes off running, prompting Kate to chase after her with urgency. Zoe narrowly avoids a near collision with a speeding Yellow Cab as she dashes across a bustling road, with Kate frantically dodging traffic in hot pursuit. However, she ultimately has to step back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off into the distance. Much later, Zoe is found on her bed, intently looking through a cherished photo album. As she flips through the pages, she discovers a peacock feather, reminiscent of the one she was playing with shortly before the car accident. She sighs deeply, her eyes welling with tears. Meanwhile, Kate makes her way down to Sean's apartment, where, in the quiet and deserted kitchen, she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter, engaging in happy, light-hearted conversation. Finally, in the midst of a heavy downpour, Nick hurriedly dashes out of his truck parked outside Kate's apartment building, determined and focused on his destination.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She gently guides Kate by the hand, leading her across the room to where a picnic is thoughtfully arranged on the lounge floor. As they settle down, they sit comfortably on soft cushions positioned in front of a warm, roaring fire, nestled under a sheet that is creatively stretched out to resemble a safari tent. The three of them begin to share slices of pizza, the ambiance filled with camaraderie. With a playful spirit, Zoe pretends to be an elephant, waving her arms and making tromping noises, eliciting laughter from the group. The three then engage in a whimsical game of pick-up sticks, using bread sticks as their playing pieces. In the gentle flicker of several candles, Zoe energetically acts out a charade, her shadow dancing beside the half-empty cafetiere of coffee, as wax slowly drips down the tall candlesticks. When Zoe succumbs to sleep on a cushion, Nick tenderly crawls around to her, carefully lifting her from the floor. As he carries her out, his shadow elongates across the side of the makeshift sheet tent. In parallel, Kate retrieves a small tray carrying two espresso cups. She pauses in the hallway, casting a watchful eye down the corridor, observing Nick as he gently carries Zoe to her bedroom and places her into bed. She then turns back, her gaze momentarily distant as she stares ahead in thoughtful reflection. Later, as the two of them tidy up, Nick opens the fridge and extracts the Tupperware box that holds the tiramisu, previously discovered by Kate in his bag. They position themselves on the lounge floor, the tiramisu between them, as Kate's face lights up with delight upon tasting a spoonful. The room is bathed in the soft glow of candlelight and the flickering firelight, casting a romantic atmosphere. Nick shifts closer to Kate, reaching out to gently wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and casually licks the cream from his finger while gazing at her intently. Kate turns her face towards Nick, meeting his gaze momentarily before looking away with a brief nod. Nick then reaches behind her, moving closer with their lips nearly touching, prompting Kate to lean back against his supportive arm. She shifts awkwardly as Nick rises, wrapping his scarf around his neck and picking up his jacket draped over the back of the sofa. He strides into the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants. As he does so, Kate watches him leave, smiling serenely to herself. When Nick later finds himself at the therapist's office, he spins around in the leather chair, while Kate sits across from him, furrowing her brow in contemplation. Afterwards, Kate finds herself joining the headmistress in her spacious office for a brief meeting before leaving. At the park, Zoe is seen gracefully walking atop benches before suddenly dashing away, prompting Kate to chase her. The situation grows tense as Zoe narrowly avoids a collision with a speeding Yellow Cab while crossing a busy road, leaving Kate to dodge the traffic frantically in pursuit. However, Kate eventually steps back, watching with a sense of helplessness as Zoe continues to run off. As the scene shifts, Zoe sits on her bed, gazing at a photo album. As she flips through the pages, she stumbles upon a peacock feather, reminiscent of one she played with shortly before the car crash. The discovery evokes a deep sigh as her eyes well up with tears. Meanwhile, Kate descends to Sean's apartment, where she and Nick find solace in each other's company within the dim and silent kitchen. They share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter, their conversation light and filled with happiness. Ultimately, in a final scene set amidst pouring rain, Nick hastily exits his truck, dashing up to the entrance of Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She leads Kate to a picnic set up on the lounge floor, where they sit on cushions near a roaring fire under a makeshift tent and share pizza with Zoe. They enjoy games, with Zoe pretending to be an elephant and playing pick-up sticks using bread sticks. By candlelight, Zoe entertains with charades before falling asleep. Nick gently lifts Zoe and carries her to bed while Kate prepares two espresso cups, taking a moment to watch him tenderly carry Zoe to her room. Later, Nick and Kate tidy up, and he retrieves a Tupperware box from the fridge. They sit on the floor sharing tiramisu, the candle and firelight casting a warm glow. Nick wipes cream from Kate's mouth, gazes at her, and moves closer, almost kissing her as she leans back against his arm. Awkwardly, Kate watches as he puts on his scarf and jacket and retrieves his pants from the kitchen. At the therapist, he spins his chair, prompting Kate to frown. She visits the headmistress's office, and afterward, Zoe plays on park benches. Zoe darts across a busy road, narrowly missing a Yellow Cab, as Kate hesitantly steps back, unable to follow. Later, Zoe finds a peacock feather in her photo album, reminiscent of one she had before the car crash, bringing tears to her eyes. Kate visits Sean's apartment, where she and Nick enjoy food and wine in the dim kitchen, conversing happily. Finally, Nick makes a dash through the pouring rain from his truck to Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She leads Kate, her younger sister who had spent the morning helping her bake, by the hand to a picnic laid out on the lounge floor. Sitting on cushions in front of a roaring fire reminiscent of a cozy winter retreat, under a sheet stretched out like a safari tent that evokes distant adventures, the trio share the pizza baked by a renowned local pizzeria. Zoe pretends to be an elephant, inspired by her recent visit to the city zoo, and the three then play pick-up sticks with bread sticks, a game known for honing fine motor skills. By the light of several candles, Zoe acts out a charade as wax drips down tall candlesticks, heirlooms from Kate's grandmother, beside a half-empty cafetiere of coffee made from locally roasted beans. Zoe fast asleep on a cushion, Nick crawls round to her and lifts her from the floor. His shadow casts on the side of the sheet tent as he carries her out, while Kate takes out a small tray with two espresso cups on it, handcrafted in a nearby pottery studio. She pauses to look down the hallway and watch Nick gently carry Zoe to her bedroom, decorated with fairy lights and colorful posters, before turning back and staring ahead thoughtfully. Later, the pair are tidying up when Nick opens the fridge and takes out the Tupperware box Kate found in his bag, which contained ingredients from a famous delicatessen. They sit on the lounge floor with a tiramisu between them; Kate's face brightens as she tastes a spoonful of the dessert, a recipe passed down from an Italian ancestor. The candles and firelight illuminate the room, casting flickering shadows, as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and licks the cream from his finger, gazing intently at her. Kate's face is turned towards Nick, but she looks away briefly and nods, thinking about the conversation they'd had earlier. He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer, lips almost touching, she leans back against his arm, feeling the warmth of the moment. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his scarf knitted by his mother and stands, picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa, and puts it on as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants, left there in haste earlier. Kate smiles serenely to herself, savoring the evening's connection. At the therapist, he spins around in his leather chair, a habit signaling the start of deep discussion, and Kate furrows her brow, pondering his probing questions. Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office, which boasts a large window overlooking the school gardens, then leaves with a decision weighing heavily on her mind. In the park, Zoe is walking on the benches, then runs off, her laughter echoing through the trees, leading Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids being hit by a Yellow Cab, the iconic symbol of the bustling city, as she runs across a busy road, and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her, adrenaline surging, but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off, her mind racing with worry. Later, Zoe is on her bed looking at the photo album, and as she flicks through it, she finds a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash, a poignant reminder of a happier time, and sighs, her eyes welling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where, in the dark and deserted kitchen once lively with gatherings, she and Nick share a plate of food prepared from leftovers and drink red wine across the serving counter, talking happily together about shared memories and future dreams. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick dashes out of his truck parked hastily outside Kate's apartment building, eager to see her once more, the storm mirroring the turmoil in his heart.

Sitting on cushions in front of a roaring fire under a sheet stretched out like a safari tent. the trio share the pizza. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. The candles and firelight illuminate the room as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth and licks the cream from his finger gazing intently at her. Kate's face is turned towards Nick but she looks away briefly and nods. He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer lips almost touching. she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his scarf and stands picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa and puts it on as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants. Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist he spins around in his leather chair and Kate furrows her brow. Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office then leaves. In the park Zoe is walking on the benches then runs off leading Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids being hit by a Yellow Cab as she runs across a busy road and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off. Later Zoe is on her bed looking at the photo album and as she flicks through it she finds a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash and sighs her eyes welling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where in the dark and deserted kitchen she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter talking happily together. Finally in the pouring rain Nick dashes out of his truck outside Kate's apartment building.

Robert narrowly avoids being hit by a Yellow Cab as he runs across a busy road, and Emily dodges the traffic to follow him, but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Robert runs off. test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She leads Kate by the hand to a banquet laid out on the cabin floor. Sitting on bean bags in front of a flickering TV, under a blanket stretched out like a circus tent, the trio share the tacos. Zoe pretends to be a lion, and the three then play pick-up sticks with licorice sticks. By the light of several lanterns, Zoe acts out a charade as oil drips down tall lanterns beside a half-empty teapot of tea. Zoe fast asleep on a futon, Nick crawls round to her and lifts her from the floor. His shadow casts on the side of the blanket tent as he carries her out, while Kate takes out a small platter with two juice glasses on it. She pauses to look down the hallway and watch Nick gently carry Zoe to her crib before turning back and staring ahead thoughtfully. Later, the pair are tidying up when Nick opens the freezer and takes out the ceramic bowl Kate found in his bag. They sit on the cabin floor with a pudding between them; Kate's face brightens as she tastes a spoonful. The lanterns and TV light illuminate the room as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to wipe a spot of frosting from the right side of her mouth, and licks the frosting from his finger, gazing intently at her. Kate's face is turned towards Nick, but she looks away briefly and nods. He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer, lips almost touching, she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his hat and stands, picks up his hoodie from the back of the armchair, and puts it on as he enters the dimly lit pantry to retrieve his shoes. Kate smiles serenely to herself. At the therapist, he spins around in his velvet chair, and Kate furrows her brow. Kate joins the librarian in her spacious study, then leaves. In the meadow, Zoe is walking on the stumps, then runs off, leading Kate to chase after her. Zoe narrowly avoids being hit by a delivery van as she runs across a busy road, and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her, but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off. Later, Zoe is on her hammock looking at the scrapbook, and as she flicks through it, she finds a seashell like the one she was playing with shortly before the boat crash and sighs, her eyes welling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's attic where, in the dark and deserted dining room, she and Nick share a bowl of soup and drink orange juice across the serving counter, talking happily together. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick dashes out of his motorcycle outside Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She guides Kate by the hand to a puzzle spread out on the lounge floor. Lounging on cushions in front of a vibrant fire, under a blanket stretched out like a circus tent, the trio enjoy the cookies. Zoe mimics a monkey, and the three then play dominoes with bread sticks. By the glow of several candles, Zoe mimics a puppet show as wax dribbles down long candlesticks beside a half-full cafetiere of coffee. Zoe snoring softly on a cushion, Nick crawls round to her and shakes her from the floor. His shadow flits on the side of the sheet tent as he jostles her out, while Kate carries out a small tray with two espresso cups on it. She lingers to glance down the hallway and watch Nick slowly jostle Zoe to her bedroom before turning back and staring ahead pensively. Later, the pair are organizing when Nick unlocks the fridge and picks out the Tupperware box Kate examined in his bag. They lounge on the lounge floor with a parfait between them; Kate's face lights up as she samples a spoonful. The candles and firelight shimmer the room as Nick slides across to sit beside Kate, reaching out to dab a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth, and tastes the cream from his finger, gazing intensely at her. Kate's face is angled towards Nick, but she glances away briefly and nods. He slips behind Kate and inches nearer, lips almost brushing, she leans back against his arm. Kate shifts uneasily as Nick wraps on his scarf and stretches, grabs his jacket from the back of the sofa, and slides it on as he enters the dim kitchen to locate his shoes. Kate grins serenely to herself. At the therapist, he swivels around in his leather chair, and Kate creases her brow. Kate meets with the headmistress in her spacious office, then departs. In the park, Zoe is skipping on the benches, then leaps off, leading Kate to tag after her. Zoe narrowly escapes being brushed by a Yellow Cab as she hurdles across a bustling road, and Kate weaves through the traffic to trail her, but ultimately hesitates and watches helplessly as Zoe dashes off. Later, Zoe is on her bed scanning the photo album, and as she browses through it, she discovers a peacock feather like the one she was tossing shortly before the car crash and exhales, her eyes filling with tears. Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where, in the dim and empty kitchen, she and Nick relish a plate of food and sip red wine across the serving counter, chatting merrily together. Finally, in the pouring rain, Nick rushes out of his car outside Kate's apartment building.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He guides Lily by the elbow to a banquet set up on the staircase. Perched on beanbags near a crackling oven, beneath a tarp stretched out like a circus tent, the duo split the sandwiches. Oliver pretends to be a giraffe, and the two then play jenga with pretzel sticks. By the flicker of numerous lanterns, Oliver mimes a skit as wax dribbles down short lantern poles beside a mostly-full carafe of lemonade. Oliver snoozing peacefully on a beanbag, Jasper creeps over to her and lifts her from the ground. His silhouette projects on the edge of the tarp tent as he carries her out, while Lily picks up a tiny platter with two teacups on it. She stops to glance down the hallway and observe Jasper softly carry Oliver to her nursery before swiveling back and gazing ahead pensively. Afterwards, the duo are cleaning up when Jasper unlatches the pantry and pulls out the glass jar Lily discovered in his satchel. They sit on the staircase with a cheesecake in front of them; Lily's expression brightens as she savors a morsel. The lanterns and oven glow brighten the area as Jasper shifts across to sit near Lily, reaching out to dab a spot of frosting from the left side of her chin, and tastes the frosting from his thumb, staring intently at her. Lily's gaze is directed at Jasper, but she glances away momentarily and nods. He reaches behind Lily and moves closer, lips nearly brushing, she leans back against his elbow. Lily adjusts uneasily as Jasper puts on his hat and stands, grabs his coat from the edge of the chair, and puts it on as he steps into the dimmed dining room to collect his gloves. Lily grins contentedly to herself. At the counselor, he pivots around in his wooden chair, and Lily wrinkles her forehead. Lily joins the principal in her airy study, then departs. In the zoo, Oliver is skipping on the fountains, then bolts off, prompting Lily to sprint after her. Oliver narrowly avoids being struck by a bicycle as she dashes across a bustling avenue, and Lily weaves through the traffic to pursue her, but ultimately halts and watches powerlessly as Oliver sprints away. Later, Oliver is on her mattress flipping through a scrapbook, and as she scans it, she discovers a beetle shell like the one she was fiddling with shortly before the bicycle mishap and groans, her eyes brimming with tears. Lily descends to Alex's loft where, in the shadowy and vacant dining room, she and Jasper share a platter of snacks and sip apple juice across the prep island, conversing joyfully together. Finally, in the cascading storm, Jasper bolts out of his sedan outside Lily's office tower.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He drags Brian by the elbow to a sculpture exhibited on the balcony. Lounging on pillows near a flickering lamp, beneath a blanket propped up like a pirate ship, the quartet devour the sandwiches. Mia imagines herself as a tiger, and the four then engage in a game of checkers with clementines. By the glow of a single lightbulb, Mia performs a skit as wax hardens on short candle stubs beside a mostly empty teapot of tea. Mia peacefully snoring on a sofa, Ben tiptoes next to her and nudges her from her perch. His silhouette shows on the surface of the blanket ship as he guides her away, while Brian picks up a medium tray with three cappuccino mugs on it. He hesitates to glance down the corridor and watch Ben carefully navigate Mia to her nursery before pivoting back and gazing forward pensively. Later, the duo are organizing clutter when Ben closes the freezer and retrieves the cookie tin Brian discovered in his pocket. They perch on the balcony floor with a mousse between them; Brianâ€™s expression lights up as he devours a bite. The lightbulb and lantern light brighten the space as Ben shifts across to perch beside Brian, reaching out to brush a bit of sugar from the left corner of his lip, and licks the sugar from his thumb, observing closely at him. Brian's eyes are fixed on Ben, but he glances aside briefly and shakes his head. She reaches in front of Brian and slides closer, noses almost grazing, he reclines away from her shoulder. Brian fidgets restlessly as Ben wraps a muffler and rises, grabs his coat from the arm of the chair, and drapes it on as he enters the dimmed pantry to locate his tie. Brian grins peacefully to himself. At the healer, she wheels around in his wooden chair, and Brian gestures in confusion. Brian consults the librarian in her vast library, then exits. In the garden, Mia is balancing on the paths, then skips away, prompting Brian to hurry after him. Mia just barely escapes being clipped by a Blue Sedan as he sprints over a bustling avenue, and Brian weaves through the bustle to pursue him, but eventually halts and watches powerlessly as Mia dashes away. Later, Mia is on his mattress examining the scrapbook, and as she turns its pages, she discovers a seashell unlike the one she was admiring shortly before the accident and exhales, her gaze filling with emotion. Brian heads up to Dana's flat where, in the dim and empty pantry, he and Ben divvy up a spread of snacks and sip orange soda across the dining table, chatting contentedly together. Eventually, in the storming downpour, Ben races from his bicycle near Brian's house complex.

Zoe narrowly dodges being grazed by a garbage truck as she sprints across a bustling avenue, and Kate navigates the traffic to pursue her, but eventually halts and watches helplessly as Zoe disappears. Later, Zoe is on her mattress leafing through the scrapbook, and as she turns the pages, she discovers a seashell like the one she was playing with shortly before the bicycle accident and exhales, her eyes misting with tears. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The rabbit guides Oliver by the wing to a campfire set up on the attic ceiling. Lounging on hammocks beside a crackling television, beneath a tarp spread out like a circus canopy, the duo munch on the lasagna. Sam pretends to be a rhinoceros, and the two then juggle marbles with pretzel rods. By the glow of several lanterns, Sam mimics a puppet show as sap drips down short flagpoles next to a half-full teapot of tea. Sam snoring loudly on a hammock, Jerry tiptoes over to him and lifts him from the ceiling. His silhouette flickers on the side of the circus canopy as he drags him away, while Oliver pulls out a large platter with three lemonade mugs on it. He pauses to glance down the staircase and observe Jerry carefully cradle Sam to his sofa before spinning back and glancing sideways thoughtfully. Eventually, the team is straightening up when Jerry searches the pantry and pulls out the mason jar Oliver discovered in his locker. They crouch on the attic ceiling with a cheesecake between them; Oliver's grin widens as he devours a forkful. The lanterns and television glow fill the attic as Jerry slides over to settle next to Oliver, extending a paw to brush a blob of jelly from the left side of his cheek, and licks the jelly from his finger, peering deeply at him. Oliverâ€™s head is turned towards Jerry, but he averts his gaze momentarily and agrees with a nod. He reaches past Oliver and edges closer, noses almost touching, he reclines against his shoulder. Oliver shifts nervously as Jerry puts on his hat and rises, grabs his cloak from the top of the armchair, and drapes it on as he exits the dimly-lit pantry to collect his gloves. Oliver grins quietly to himself. At the librarian's, Jerry whirls in his fabric hammock, and Oliver squints his eyes. Oliver meets the chef in her tiny hut, then departs. In the zoo, Sam is balancing on the benches, then skips away, prompting Oliver to dash after him. Sam narrowly escapes being tackled by a green Jellybean as he scurries across a crowded path, and Oliver weaves through the crowd to shadow him, but ultimately retreats and observes silently as Sam skips away. Soon, Sam is on his hammock leafing through the scrapbook, and as he flips through it, he uncovers a seashell like the one he was playing with shortly before the bicycle mishap and exhales, his eyes brimming with mist. Oliver strolls down to Rosa's penthouse where, in the dim and empty pantry, he and Jerry enjoy a bowl of pasta and sip white lemonade across the chopping board, chatting cheerfully together. Finally, in the drizzling mist, Jerry sprints out of his helicopter outside Oliver's cottage.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Kate leads Zoe and Nick to a picnic on the lounge floor, enjoying pizza and playing games under a makeshift tent by the fire. As they share charades by candlelight, Zoe falls asleep, and Nick gently carries her to bed. Kate watches thoughtfully before they enjoy tiramisu together, with Nick tenderly wiping cream from Kate's face, evoking a brief moment of intimacy before he leaves. At a therapy session, Kate appears reflective, and later at the headmistress's office, she seems contemplative. In the park, Zoe narrowly avoids a traffic accident, leaving Kate worried and helpless. Zoe later finds a poignant peacock feather in her photo album, stirring emotions linked to a past car crash. Meanwhile, Kate shares a joyful meal and wine with Nick in Sean's empty kitchen. The scene ends with Nick running through the rain to Kate's apartment building, indicating a deepening relationship.

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: Kate's face is turned towards Nick but she looks away briefly and nods By the light of several candles Zoe acts out a charade as wax drips down tall candlesticks beside a halfempty cafetiere of coffee His shadow casts on the side of the sheet tent as he carries her out while Kate takes out a small tray with two espresso cups on it She pauses to look down the hallway and watch Nick gently carry Zoe to her bedroom before turning back and staring ahead thoughtfully The candles and firelight illuminate the room as Nick moves across to sit beside Kate reaching out to wipe a spot of cream from the right side of her mouth and licks the cream from his finger gazing intently at her she leans back against his arm At the therapist he spins around in his leather chair and Kate furrows her brow Zoe narrowly avoids being hit by a Yellow Cab as she runs across a busy road and Kate dodges the traffic to follow her but ultimately steps back and watches helplessly as Zoe runs off They sit on the lounge floor with a tiramisu between them Kate joins the headmistress in her spacious office then leaves Zoe pretends to be an elephant and the three then play pickup sticks with bread sticks Later Zoe is on her bed looking at the photo album and as she flicks through it she finds a peacock feather like the one she was playing with shortly before the car crash and sighs her eyes welling with tears Zoe fast asleep on a cushion Kate shifts awkwardly as Nick puts on his scarf and stands picks up his jacket from the back of the sofa and puts it on as he enters the darkened kitchen to retrieve his pants He reaches behind Kate and moves nearer lips almost touching the trio share the pizza Kate smiles serenely to herself Sitting on cushions in front of a roaring fire under a sheet stretched out like a safari tent Kate's face brightens as she tastes a spoonful In the park Zoe is walking on the benches then runs off leading Kate to chase after her Nick crawls round to her and lifts her from the floor Kate goes down to Sean's apartment where in the dark and deserted kitchen she and Nick share a plate of food and drink red wine across the serving counter talking happily together Finally in the pouring rain Nick dashes out of his truck outside Kate's apartment building She leads Kate by the hand to a picnic laid out on the lounge floor Later the pair are tidying up when Nick opens the fridge and takes out the Tupperware box Kate found in his bag
